speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, you're going to have to clear out.  Daphne and I are meeting with my lawyer.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know why you have to go with that high-priced lady instead of the guy I recommended.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please.  Donny is suing me for emotional distress.  Your guy wanted me to limp into court wearing a neck brace and claiming not to speak English.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you don't keep an office in the mall for twelve years without knowin' a few tricks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I'm sorry I'm late.  Is Abby here yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, she's on her way.

speaker: Niles
text: These lawsuits have me so rattled.  You know me, Frasier, normally I'm unflappable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, if you flapped any more, we'd have to lower you to half mast on Veteran's Day.

speaker: Niles
text: Sherry, anyone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, please.  I know how Niles feels.  I'm a nervous wreck about that deposition tomorrow.  First time I'm seeing Donny since our wedding day, and he's going to be grilling me under oath.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't worry.  Once Abby preps you, you'll have nothing to worry about.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't understand you guys.  Instead of you each hiring expensive lawyers, why don't you just settle?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because we didn't do anything wrong, Dad!  Daphne merely changed her mind about getting married and although Donny is entitled to his pain, he is not entitled to sue everyone under the sun.

speaker: Martin
text: [_rising_] You guys are nuts.  Donny's a pit bull.  Why don't you come up with some cash, put it on a stick and shove it into his cage?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, thank you, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: And don't even try to get the stick back.  Just run.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad's fear notwithstanding, I have every confidence in Abby and her litigious prowess.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, we've all seen you admiring her prowess.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure I have no idea what you're talking about.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Abby.  Come on in. You know Niles and Daphne, of course.

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, yes, hello, Daphne, Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, let me take your coat.

speaker: Abby
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my.  That suit is very becoming on you.  Is it new?

speaker: Abby
text: Yes it is.  And thank you for noticing, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thank you for being so, ah... noticeable.

speaker: Niles
text: [_aside to Daphne_] Do I sound like that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, but it's cute when you do it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, make yourself comfortable.  Well, we're anxious to hear your, your battle plan.  We realize it's going to be tough, but we're ready for a fight.

speaker: Abby
text: Donny's dropped the lawsuits.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: When did this happen?

speaker: Abby
text: He just called me on my cell phone now.  I took the liberty of calling your lawyer, Daphne, to let him know the good news, too.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: So, what happens now?

speaker: Abby
text: Nothing.  You've won.  Congratulations.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't believe it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Did Donny say why he's dropping the case?

speaker: Abby
text: No, he did not.  But we can call and ask him if you'd like.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I think I know why he dropped the case: because I have the finest lawyer in all of Seattle.

speaker: Niles
text: Hear, hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Thank you for a job well done.

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, my pleasure.  Congratulations.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you, Abby.

speaker: Abby
text: Congratulations.  You're welcome, Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Abby
text: Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks.

speaker: Abby
text: Absolutely. _Frasier has followed them around and is standing in front of her once more._

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, you again!

speaker: Abby
text: Well, I must say, I was actually looking forward to getting a shot at Donny in court, but for your sake, I'm glad things ended this way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you know, there's no reason this has to be goodbye. I think a celebratory dinner is in order.

speaker: Abby
text: Well, great.  Give me a call and we'll see when all of us can get together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, all of us.  Yes, well, you know, our schedules are really rather complicated.  We're rarely available together.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm open.

speaker: Daphne
text: Any time's good for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, dinner it is.

speaker: Abby
text: Great.  I hate to rush, but I've got a mountain of paperwork.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, let me walk you to the elevator.

speaker: Abby
text: All right. That's very sweet, Frasier.  Thank you for escorting me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, for being so... escortable.

speaker: Daphne
text: Bye, Abby.

speaker: Abby
text: Goodbye.

speaker: Niles
text: Congratulations again. _Frasier and Abby go out the front.  Resett to - the hall.  Frasier helps Abby on with her coat._

speaker: Frasier
text: Abby, I just wanted to say how pleasurable it's been getting to know you.

speaker: Abby
text: The pleasure's been all mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you know, I'd hate to see my relationship with you end, uh, right now.  I just...

speaker: Abby
text: Frasier, if you're going to ask me out, you better hurry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you go out with me?

speaker: Abby
text: Yes! _The doors close on her word.  Frasier grins happily and turns back to his door.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Martin is reading, Frasier opens the door to Roz._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on in, I'll get you situated.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks for letting me tape your CDs.

speaker: Martin
text: Since when do you two have the same taste in music?

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, it's for Alice.  I read an article that said listening to classical music makes toddlers smarter. Something about making their brain bigger, or wider... I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: I believe the word you're looking for is "smartified."

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah?  Well guess which word I'm looking for now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny.  Actually, I have the perfect piece to start Alice off with: it's Beethoven's Sonata  in C-Sharp Minor. I've laid out a selection of CDs that I think will be appropriate.  I'm sorry, I don't have time to put together a comprehensive program for you.  But actually, Dad and I have our celebratory dinner tonight with Abby.  You know, Dad, actually, you should get ready to go.

speaker: Martin
text: I thought I was ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: Think tie!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm way ahead of ya.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, you've been spending a lot of time "celebrating" with this lawyer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes.  Well, actually, we've been out a couple of times.  I'm really rather taken with her.  She has a very playful side.  She took me miniature golfing last night.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh sure.  When she takes you it's playful, when I take you it ends up as a story in the high school literary magazine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, "Through the Clown's Mouth Darkly" took second in the all-city fiction contest that year.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, these are for you.  Your doorman gave them to me. Apparently some of your mail went to the wrong box.  And these are for you, my love.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles, you spoil me.

speaker: Niles
text: I picked them myself.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh, Niles, cookies.

speaker: Niles
text: Sweets for my sweet.

speaker: Daphne
text: Let's go put these in some milk.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, I was just going to say that!

speaker: Daphne
text: No you weren't.

speaker: Niles
text: I was, I swear.

speaker: Daphne
text: OK, this is gettin' spooky.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well.

speaker: Martin
text: What is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I just opened Abby's bill.  It seems... awfully high.  I guess this must be the going rate.

speaker: Martin
text: Whoa!

speaker: Frasier
text: I think Abby is worth every penny.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she better be, because Daphne's lawyer only charged half this much.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that doesn't seem right, does it?  I mean, they did the same amount of work...

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, Fras, Abby isn't the first lawyer to pad a bill.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well maybe not, but you know, Abby is not that kind of lawyer.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, what world are you livin' in?  They're all "that kind of lawyer."

speaker: Frasier
text: I admit four thousand dollars does seem rather high for phone consultations.  Who the hell's she talking to?

speaker: Martin
text: All her friends, braggin' about the new sucker she's got on the line.  _Roz bursts out laughing.  FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - The Restaurant Fade in.  They are all seated around a table._

speaker: Niles
text: This restaurant has a wonderful Roquefort ravioli.

speaker: Daphne
text: I kind of had my heart set on lobster.  Come and help me pick one out.

speaker: Niles
text: I was just getting up to do that!

speaker: Daphne
text: No you weren't.

speaker: Niles
text: I was too.

speaker: Both
text: Spooky!

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Abby, you happen to get any interesting e-mails today?

speaker: Abby
text: Yes I did.  But none that I feel comfortable discussing in front of your father.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Abby, you'll like this one, we used to tell it in the precinct: How many lawyers does it take to screw in a light bulb?

speaker: Abby
text: I don't know.  It depends on how many cops planted it there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thrust and parry, Dad!

speaker: Abby
text: Excuse me. [_into phone_] Abby Michaels.  Hold on. [_to Frasier_] It's a client.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sotto voice to Frasier_] Startin' the meter, huh?

speaker: Abby
text: I've already filed that motion, it's up to them, now. ... No, no, no.  I don't think that they would try that.  But if you like, I can call them, or better yet, I can send them a letter just so we're on the record.  OK, bye now.

speaker: Abby
text: Sorry.  Where were we?

speaker: Martin
text: [_tapping his watch_] Aren't you forgettin' somethin'?

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, my goodness, you're right.  It's getting very late and I haven't even looked at the menu yet.  My, so many choices. What are you guys having?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm pretty sure someone's gettin' scrod...  _Daphne and Niles come back and take their seats as the waiter pours the champagne._

speaker: Abby
text: So how were the lobsters?

speaker: Daphne
text: They were too cute to eat.  I'm having the veal.

speaker: Abby
text: Well, I propose a toast: to frivolous lawsuits and the wonderful, charming clients they bring together.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, hear, hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: Abby, I'm sorry to spoil the mood, it's just... your client.

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, right.  Thanks for reminding me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't believe it.  Donny just walked in.

speaker: Niles
text: I said don't look!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you did not!

speaker: Niles
text: Can you imagine anything more embarrassing than seeing us here tonight?

speaker: Abby
text: Your menu's on fire.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, yes, that would be embarrassing... OH!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not in the Dom Perignon.

speaker: Niles
text: Careful. _Abby finally grabs it and pushes it into the ice and water in the wine bucket._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank God.

speaker: Donny
text: Hi, Guys.

speaker: Donny
text: Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Donny.

speaker: Donny
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello Donny.

speaker: Donny
text: Look, I realize you guys must be celebrating, but do you have to start a bonfire?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, celebrating?

speaker: Martin
text: He thinks we're celebrating.

speaker: Donny
text: Look, I know this is a little awkward, but I understand, don't worry.  In fact, I'm celebrating something myself.

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, you won a big case, Donny?

speaker: Donny
text: No.  I, uh, I got engaged.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Boy, that's good news.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, yes it certainly is.

speaker: Donny
text: Thank you.  In fact, she's sitting right over there.

speaker: Donny
text: Wave, Nancy.  Show 'em the rock.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's a big one.

speaker: Niles
text: Congratulations, Donny.

speaker: Donny
text: Thank you.  I was representing her in her divorce and we realized that we were... perfect... for each other.  And, I know it's very sudden, but that's fate for you, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, good luck.

speaker: Donny
text: Thanks.  I should get back to Nancy, and you guys enjoy your dinner.  And, incidentally, the fire exits are located there and there.  _He makes the flight attendant motion with his arms.  Everyone laughs nervously and he goes over to the other table._

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, that was weird.

speaker: Daphne
text: Now we know why he dropped the lawsuit.

speaker: Abby
text: Yes, he's in love.

speaker: Daphne
text: Or on the rebound.

speaker: Abby
text: Well, either way, it's good news for all of you.  In fact let's order another bottle of champagne.  And by the way, dinner is on me, or rather, the firm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no.  I couldn't let you do that, Abby.  I wanted to pay for dinner.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't worry, you are.  _Frasier gives him a sour look.  FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **GOING UP**  _Scene 1 - Frasier's Building Fade in.  Frasier is waiting for the elevator in the lobby.  Niles comes up behind him._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier, I was just coming up to see you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Niles.  Say, you're looking a little green around the gills.

speaker: Niles
text: Please, don't even mention gills.  The Yale Club had its annual luncheon at Vashon Island, all seafood.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, didn't agree with you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, the food was fine.  It was the four-foot swells coming back on the ferry that didn't agree with me.  I'm afraid I was forced to return my sea bass to the sea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I had sort of a rough day myself.  I can't stop thinking about the bill Abby sent me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, after witnessing her rather slipshod record keeping last night, I, I can't help feeling I'm getting ripped off.  So, I fired off a strongly worded e-mail today, insisting on a point-by-point accounting of my bill.  _The elevator arrives and they get on. Reset to: Inside the Elevator._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, good idea.  Nothing cements a relationship like calling the girl a crook.

speaker: Frasier
text: Speaking of relationships, how about Donny's decision to get engaged?  My God, talk about classic rebound behavior.

speaker: Niles
text: Classic.  Is it just me, or is this elevator swaying?

speaker: Frasier
text: Certainly not the wisest decision Donny could have made at this point. You know, maybe somebody should have a talk with him.

speaker: Niles
text: Stop!  Don't even think about it.  Right now the only thing Donny needs is to be left alone.  _The elevator comes to a stop, Niles reaches for the wall.  When the doors open, Daphne is standing there._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Where are you off to?

speaker: Daphne
text: I've got to see Donny.  _Niles gives a little nod, then grabs for the door and gets on the elevator with her._

speaker: Niles
text: Why in the world do you have to see Donny?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm worried about him.  He's making such a rash decision. I just want to make sure he's OK.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not just about that.  We never really had a proper goodbye, and I feel bad leaving things the way we did.

speaker: Niles
text: [_putting his hand on hers_] What you're looking for is... [_he makes a dry heave_] ...closure.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I knew you'd understand. [_She looks closer at him._] Niles, are you feeling OK?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes.  I feel fine.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, in that case, when I get back this will all be behind us. We can celebrate!  I'll make us a nice big English country dinner: steak and kidney pudding. _He looks less than thrilled at this.  When the elevator stops, Daphne gets off and Roz rushes up._

speaker: Roz
text: Hold the elevator!  Hey, Daphne.  Niles!  I need your opinion.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, really, I was just about to...

speaker: Roz
text: I need some more classical music to tape for Alice.

speaker: Niles
text: What?  _The elevator starts and he throws his hands out, off balance. She pulls a piece of paper from her purse._

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  Frasier gave me this list, but it has over three hundred names on it.  Who do you think is best? [_She holds the paper out._]

speaker: Niles
text: I would really rather not read right now.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, oh, off the top of your head.  Alice really loves those up-tempo numbers.  Last night we were listening to "Peer Gynt," and she started doing all these little ballerina moves. You should have seen her, she was so cute!  She would sway back and forth to the music and do these little spins and jumps.  I was doing them with her but I started getting so dizzy.  The room went around and around and around...  _Niles has watched her, looking less and less stable.  The elevator stops and the doors open._

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, never mind, I'll ask Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, where are you going?  What about the CD?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.  Take what you like and mark it down on the sign- out sheet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, thank God you're here.  Come with me.  Listen, there was a message from Abby on the machine.  She says she needs to see me right away.

speaker: Frasier
text: She must have gotten my e-mail.  God, the message was so short that I can't really tell what sort of mood she's in.  I guess if she had been really angry, she would have left some indication on the machine.  Well, then again, being a savvy lawyer, you know, she might not want to tip her hand.  Well, whatever happens, I feel confident that I made the right decision.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thanks, Niles.  You've been a support.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, great news: Tony the chili guy got his license back. Check it out!  _He puts the bag under Niles' nose.  Niles very carefully and slowly walks away.  FADE OUT._  _Scene 2 - The Courthouse Fade in.  Donny is standing in front of one of the rooms.  A man comes up to him._

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, you have the rings?

speaker: Best Man
text: [_patting his pocket_] Right here.  You nervous?

speaker: Donny
text: Well, gee, yeah.  I'm excited.  I can't believe Nancy's gonna be my wife after all these... weeks.

speaker: Donny
text: OK.

speaker: Donny
text: Daphne, what are you doing here?

speaker: Daphne
text: Your receptionist told me you'd left for court.

speaker: Donny
text: Actually, this is not a good time.

speaker: Daphne
text: I know.  You're probably in the middle of a big trial so I'll be brief.  Donny, after seeing you at the restaurant last night, I want you to know I'm worried about you.

speaker: Donny
text: OK, this is about Nancy?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sure she's a lovely person.  And I probably have no right saying this, but I hope you're not rushing into anything.

speaker: Donny
text: Uh, look, Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: I know, I know.  I'm way out of line here.  But, I still care what happens to you.  Take the time to get to know each other. Believe me, you'll be glad you did when the day comes you finally do get married.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what do you know, it's here.

speaker: Donny
text: I'll meet you inside.  I'll be one second, all right?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm so sorry.  My timing's so terrible.

speaker: Donny
text: Not really.  If you hang around a few minutes, I'm sure we can get you on the wedding video.

speaker: Daphne
text: I really had no idea you were getting married so soon.

speaker: Donny
text: Well, call me crazy, but I've got a prejudice against long engagements.

speaker: Donny
text: Mom.

speaker: Mrs. Douglas
text: Oh, Sweety, you look so handsome. [_She notices Daphne and gasps._] It's you!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Mother Douglas.

speaker: Mrs. Douglas
text: MRS. Douglas.  You have some nerve showing up here.

speaker: Donny
text: Mom.

speaker: Mrs. Douglas
text: You can beg all you want, but he's not coming back.

speaker: Donny
text: Mom, Mom.

speaker: Mrs. Douglas
text: He's done crying his eyes out over you.

speaker: Donny
text: Mom, Mom, she knows, she knows.

speaker: Mrs. Douglas
text: Why don't you go back...?

speaker: Donny
text: Look, Daphne, I don't mean to rush you, but is there anything else?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just this: I never really said how sorry I was about what happened.  I really am.

speaker: Donny
text: Well, Daphne, if it puts your mind at ease, I know what I'm doing.  I'm happy, I'm ready to go on with my life.  So...

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, I know.  I'm... [_to Daphne_] Goodbye.

speaker: Daphne
text: Donny.

speaker: Daphne
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Donny
text: Thank you, Daphne.  _He goes inside.  Daphne looks a bit melancholy and walks off. FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - Abby's Office Fade in.  Abby is at her computer with a technician. Frasier comes in._

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, there you are.

speaker: Frasier
text: I got your message.  You sounded kind of urgent so I came right down.  I suppose you read my e-mail.

speaker: Abby
text: No.  Actually my computer's been down all day.  But if it's anything like the last one we'll know what overheated my hard drive.

speaker: Technician
text: Give it a few minutes to reconnect to the server and then it will be up and running.

speaker: Abby
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, ah, why did you call me?

speaker: Abby
text: Well, Frasier, I thought we could celebrate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really.  Celebrate what?

speaker: Abby
text: Well, this morning I was called down to the conference room and all the partners were there.  I thought they were going to yell at me because they found out I'd given you a discount, but instead, they told me I made partner.

speaker: Frasier
text: You gave me a discount?  I mean, I mean congratulations.

speaker: Abby
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God, you certainly deserve it. [_He pulls back._] What kind of discount?

speaker: Abby
text: You didn't even notice, did you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no I did notice.  I did.  I swear to God I noticed. I even pointed it out to Dad.

speaker: Abby
text: That's very sweet.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're the sweet one.

speaker: Abby
text: I'm not always... [_she pulls her top open and off_] ...sweet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Abby.

speaker: Computer
text: You have e-mail!

speaker: Abby
text: I'm not reading them!  The office is closed.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's a very good decision.  That is partner-level thinking.

speaker: Abby
text: Wait!  What am I thinking?  You sent me another one of those naughty e-mails, haven't you?  Maybe we should act this one out.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no!  Actually, I just forwarded you an ad for reduced mortgage rates.

speaker: Abby
text: Why are you blushing, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because they're embarrassingly low.

speaker: Abby
text: This says "Re: Our Relationship".

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you're on to me.  Just come here and sit down and relax.  And I will read it to you.  Prepare to be... scandalized.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Dear Abby, I read your column every week."   Kidding.  Now, here's the real stuff, now.  Um, "I'm, ah, lying here in bed and I can't stop thinking about you."

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, this is getting good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you like that, do you?  Uh, "Your golden hair cascades down your bare shoulders and I kiss the curve at the back of your neck."

speaker: Abby
text: I'm very lonely over here. _She gets up and walks towards him.  He hits a key and there is a beep from the computer._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, I deleted it by accident.

speaker: Abby
text: Oh, no, that's too bad.  I really wanted to hear the rest of that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know what?  We can write a new ending together. But there's no need to rush.  We'll just start very slowly, at the beginning.  And then, we'll move, gently, into the middle.  And then I'm sure you'll want to add a few plot twists of your own. _He takes off his jacket, tosses it on the floor and sits on the couch. There is a beep from the printer and Abby takes a sheet from it._

speaker: Frasier
text: And finally, we'll just...what are you reading?

speaker: Abby
text: Your e-mail.  You printed it by mistake.  You think I'm ripping you off?!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  No, no!  I did not use those words!  Actually, I, I just took issue with a couple of figures.

speaker: Abby
text: And you come in here and lie to me?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, "lie" is a very strong word.

speaker: Abby
text: Well, so is "chiseler".

speaker: Frasier
text: Abby, I realize I've made a terrible mistake, and I wrote some very harsh things.  But, to my credit, I did attempt to delete it before you got a chance to read it.

speaker: Abby
text: Get out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on!  Look at the two of us.  We can't stay mad at each other.

speaker: Abby
text: I said get out!

speaker: Abby
text: And to think that I almost slept with you. _She throws the jacket at him and slams the door.  CUT TO: the hallway, where Frasier has the jacket on his head._

speaker: Frasier
text: You still can!
